definitions: undergo an event or occurrence that leaves an impression on someone
have practical contact with and observation of facts or events over time
examples: She experienced great joy at her daughter's wedding
We experienced some delays during our journey
He has experienced many different cultures through travel
The doctor experienced similar cases in her career

definitions: regularly or frequently behave in a particular way or have a certain characteristic
care for or look after someone or something with attention and responsibility
examples: Children tend to imitate their parents' behavior
Prices tend to rise during holiday seasons
Nurses tend patients with compassion and skill
She tends her garden every morning

definitions: throw back heat light or sound without absorbing it from a surface
think deeply or carefully about something in a contemplative manner
embody or represent something in a faithful or appropriate way
examples: The mirror reflects light from the window
The lake reflects the mountains perfectly
Take time to reflect on your decisions
She reflected on her childhood memories
His actions reflect his true character
The report reflects current market conditions

definitions: state or describe exactly the nature scope or meaning of something
mark out the boundary or limits of something clearly and precisely
examples: The dictionary defines words clearly and accurately
Let me define what I mean by success
Mountains define the border between the countries
These rules define acceptable behavior

definitions: touch feel or hold with the hands physically
manage a situation or problem effectively with skill or care
examples: Handle the glass carefully because it's fragile
Please don't handle the merchandise without permission
She handles pressure very well at work
Can you handle this project on your own

definitions: require the payment of a specified sum of money to buy or obtain
cause the loss or sacrifice of something valuable as a consequence
examples: This dress costs fifty dollars on sale
How much does the ticket cost
His mistake cost the company millions
The delay cost us valuable time

definitions: make a public and typically formal declaration about a fact or intention
examples: The company will announce the merger tomorrow
She announced her engagement at the party

definitions: give food to a person or animal to eat regularly
supply with material or information to maintain or develop something
examples: Please feed the cat twice a day
Parents feed their children nutritious meals
This river feeds into the larger lake
New data feeds the ongoing research

definitions: believe in the reliability truth ability or strength of someone or something
have confidence or hope that something will happen as expected
examples: I trust my best friend completely
You can trust this brand for quality
We trust that you'll make the right decision
I trust everything will work out well

definitions: bring and hand over a letter parcel or ordered goods to the recipient
give birth to a baby with or without medical assistance
carry out or fulfill a promise commitment or responsibility successfully
examples: The postal service delivers mail six days weekly
Can you deliver this package tomorrow
The doctor delivered three babies last night
She delivered twins at the hospital
The team delivered excellent results this quarter
He always delivers on his promises

definitions: put an end to the existence of something by damaging it beyond repair
ruin someone emotionally or spiritually through severe damage or trauma
examples: The fire destroyed several buildings downtown
Termites can destroy wooden structures completely
The betrayal destroyed their friendship forever
Losing everything destroyed his confidence

definitions: join in marriage as spouses through a legal or religious ceremony
combine or blend two things successfully in a harmonious way
examples: They plan to marry next summer
He married his college sweetheart
This recipe marries sweet and savory flavors
The design marries function with beauty

definitions: assure someone that one will definitely do give or arrange something
give good grounds for expecting a particular occurrence or situation
examples: I promise to call you tomorrow
She promised to keep the secret
The weather promises to be beautiful
This young athlete promises great success

definitions: be present at an event meeting or function as a participant
give attention to someone or something with care and thought
examples: Please attend the meeting at three o'clock
Over 500 people attended the conference
The nurse will attend to your needs
You must attend to these matters immediately

definitions: put something back in a previous place or position after removal
take the place of someone or something with a substitute
examples: Replace the book on the shelf when done
Don't forget to replace the cap
They need to replace the broken window
Who will replace her when she retires

definitions: successfully bring about or reach a desired objective through effort skill or courage
examples: She achieved her goal of running a marathon
The team achieved remarkable results this year

definitions: hit forcefully and deliberately with one's hand or a weapon
refuse to work as a form of organized protest for better conditions
occur suddenly and have harmful or damaging effects on someone or something
examples: Lightning struck the tree during the storm
He struck the ball with great force
Workers will strike for higher wages tomorrow
The union voted to strike indefinitely
Disaster struck without warning last night
The illness struck him in his prime

definitions: determine the total number of items in a collection by enumerating
be significant or important enough to be worth considering
examples: Count the money before leaving the bank
Can you count to one hundred in Spanish
Every vote counts in this election
Your opinion really counts to me

definitions: occupy attract or involve someone's interest or attention actively
agree to marry someone with a formal promise or commitment
examples: This activity will engage students' creativity
She knows how to engage her audience
They got engaged on Valentine's Day
He engaged her with a diamond ring

definitions: move creating an air current or be moved by the wind
damage destroy or remove something by using explosives or force
examples: The wind blows strongly near the coast
Blow out the candles on your cake
They will blow up the old building tomorrow
The storm blew the roof off

definitions: convey a thought or feeling in words or by gestures and conduct
squeeze out liquid or air from something by pressing firmly
examples: She expressed her gratitude with a letter
It's hard to express how I feel
Express the juice from fresh oranges
Express excess water from the cloth

definitions: give support confidence or hope to someone through words or actions
examples: Parents should encourage their children's interests
The coach encourages players during practice

definitions: be of importance or significance to someone or in a situation
examples: Your health matters more than your wealth
It doesn't matter what others think

definitions: form one's features into a pleased kind or amused expression with lips curved
examples: She smiled warmly at the children
He couldn't help but smile at the joke

definitions: discharge a gun or other weapon by causing a bullet to be released
dismiss an employee from a job usually for cause or poor performance
bake or dry something in a kiln to harden or set it permanently
examples: The soldier fired his rifle at the target
Don't fire until you see the enemy
The company fired him for repeated absences
They had to fire several employees
The potter fires her ceramics at high temperature
We need to fire these clay pots

definitions: organize and carry out a particular activity or process systematically
behave in a particular way especially in public or formal situations
examples: Scientists conduct experiments in the laboratory
She will conduct the orchestra tonight
Students must conduct themselves properly at school
How you conduct yourself matters professionally

definitions: finish making or doing something to bring it to an end
make something whole or perfect by adding what is missing
examples: Please complete the form before submitting
She completed her degree last year
This final piece completes the puzzle
Your presence completes our celebration

definitions: indicate or show that one is not willing to do or accept something
examples: She refused to answer their questions
I refuse to believe that story

definitions: present someone by name to another person formally for first meeting
bring something into use or operation for the first time
examples: Let me introduce you to my colleague
She introduced herself to the new neighbors
The company will introduce new products next month
Schools introduce children to basic mathematics

definitions: move or cause to move by turning over and over on axis
form something flexible into a cylindrical or spherical shape
examples: The ball rolled down the hill
Roll the dice to start the game
Roll the dough thin for pizza
She rolled her sleeves up

definitions: receive money in return for labor or services provided regularly
gain or deserve something through one's actions or qualities
examples: She earns a good salary as a doctor
Students can earn money with part-time jobs
He earned respect through hard work
You've earned a well-deserved vacation

definitions: inspect someone or something in detail to determine condition or quality
test the knowledge or proficiency of someone formally through questions
examples: The doctor will examine you thoroughly
Scientists examine evidence carefully
The professor will examine students next week
The board examines candidates for certification

definitions: obtain or secure something desired beneficial or profitable
increase the amount or rate of something over time
examples: She hopes to gain experience abroad
The political party gained more supporters
Stock prices gained five percent today
He gained weight during the holidays

definitions: occur or follow as the effect or consequence of something
examples: Poor planning will result in failure
These changes resulted from customer feedback

definitions: refuse to take notice of or acknowledge someone or something deliberately
examples: Don't ignore the warning signs
She chose to ignore his rude comments

definitions: greet someone arriving in a glad friendly or hospitable way
be glad to receive or accept something as desired or pleasing
examples: We welcome all visitors to our home
The hotel staff welcomed us warmly
I welcome your suggestions for improvement
The team welcomes new challenges

definitions: push oneself off a surface into the air using leg muscles
increase suddenly and by a large amount in level or value
examples: The children love to jump on the trampoline
She jumped over the small stream
Prices jumped after the announcement
Sales jumped twenty percent last month

definitions: advance someone to a higher position or rank in organization
support or actively encourage a cause venture or aim publicly
examples: The company will promote her to manager
He was promoted after five years
They promote healthy eating in schools
The campaign promotes environmental awareness

definitions: cause someone to remember someone or something typically by association
examples: Please remind me about the meeting tomorrow
This song reminds me of my childhood

definitions: be of the right shape and size for someone or something
be suitable or appropriate for a particular situation or purpose
examples: These shoes don't fit me properly
The key fits perfectly in the lock
Her skills fit the job requirements
This solution fits our needs perfectly

definitions: take another person's property without permission or legal right secretly
examples: Someone tried to steal my bicycle yesterday
Don't steal ideas from other writers

definitions: shed tears as an expression of distress pain or sorrow
shout or exclaim something suddenly in fear surprise or excitement
examples: The baby cried all night long
She cried tears of joy at graduation
He cried out in pain
The crowd cried for help

definitions: pledge or bind to a certain course or policy through promise
carry out or perpetrate a mistake crime or immoral act
examples: She committed to finishing the project
We're committed to environmental protection
They committed fraud against the company
He was accused of committing theft

definitions: connect someone or something with something else in one's mind
spend time with someone as a companion or colleague regularly
examples: People associate owls with wisdom
I always associate this smell with home
She doesn't associate with her former friends
He associates with successful entrepreneurs

definitions: bring or gather things together from different places or people
accumulate and keep particular items as a hobby or investment
examples: Please collect all the papers after class
We need to collect data for research
He collects rare stamps from around the world
She collects vintage jewelry

definitions: be or cause to be destroyed by fire or heat
damage injure or mark by heat fire or radiation
examples: The wood burns slowly in the fireplace
Don't let the dinner burn
She burned her hand on the stove
The sun burned his skin

definitions: emerge or cause to emerge from a state of sleep
make someone alert to a situation or feeling
examples: I wake up at six every morning
Don't wake the baby
The accident woke him to life's fragility
This experience woke her ambition

definitions: give something such as money or time to help achieve or provide
help to cause or bring about something through one's actions
examples: Please contribute to the charity fund
Everyone contributed ideas for the project
Poor diet contributes to health problems
Her research contributed to medical advances

definitions: sit on and travel in or on a vehicle as a passenger
sit on and control the movement of an animal or bicycle
examples: Let's ride the bus to downtown
Children love to ride the carousel
She rides her horse every weekend
Can you ride a motorcycle

definitions: request something to be made supplied or delivered especially in restaurant
give an authoritative direction or instruction to do something
arrange things in a particular sequence or structured way methodically
examples: I'll order pizza for dinner tonight
She ordered a new dress online
The general ordered troops to advance
The judge ordered silence in court
Please order these files by date
We need to order our priorities
